description: A unique identifier for each project, represented as a numerical value.
The category of the project call, with possible values including Explore and Contribute.
A unique identifier for the applicant, typically in the format ORD followed by a series of numbers.
The name of the main institution associated with the applicant.
The type of applicant, categorized as either Primary or Secondary.
The title of the applicant, such as Prof. Dr.
The first name of the applicant.
The last name of the applicant.
The institution affiliated with the applicant.
The name of the department within the applicant's institution.
The name of the laboratory associated with the applicant.
The ORCID identifier for the applicant.
The title of the project.
A shortened acronym representing the project title.
A brief summary or abstract of the project.
Relevant keywords associated with the project.
The start date of the project in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
The duration of the project in months, represented as a numerical value.
The amount of funding requested for the project, represented as a numerical value.
A unique identifier for each project, represented as a numerical value.
The cost of personnel for senior staff in Swiss Francs (CHF), expected to be a numerical value.
The cost of personnel for postdoctoral researchers in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
The cost of personnel for other staff members in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
The cost of personnel for students in Swiss Francs (CHF), expected to be a numerical value.
The cost of travel expenses in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
The cost of equipment in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
The cost of publication expenses in Swiss Francs (CHF), expected to be a numerical value.
The cost of social expenses in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
The cost of other expenses in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
The cost of subcontracting in Swiss Francs (CHF), represented as a numerical value.
A unique identifier for each project, represented as a numerical value.
A unique identifier for each item within a project, represented as a numerical value with decimal places.
A detailed name describing the item, such as 'New or enhanced webs' or 'New or enhanced data'.
A brief name summarizing the item, such as 'website', 'repository', or 'dataset'.
The number of items, represented as a discrete numerical value.
A text description providing additional context about the item.
A URL linking to the item or its associated resource, such as a website or repository.
The URL linking to the specific research project's details or webpage.
The title of the research project.
The category or classification of the research project, such as Contribute, Explore, or Establish.
The institutions involved in the research project, such as EPFL, ETH Zurich, or Empa.
The type of data associated with the research project, such as Microstructure data, Environmental data, or Medical data.
The field of study or discipline of the research project, such as Materials Science, Earth sciences, or Life sciences.
The names of the researchers involved in the project.
A brief summary or abstract of the research project.
